semantic_title: Sequencing Guidelines for Encounter for Treatment of Secondary Malignancy
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > l. Sequencing of neoplasm codes > 2) Encounter for treatment of secondary malignancy

content.full_text: When an encounter is for a primary malignancy with metastasis and treatment is directed toward the metastatic (secondary) site(s) only, the metastatic site(s) is designated as the principal/first-listed diagnosis. The primary malignancy is coded as an additional code. (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L31)
content.summary: Guidelines for sequencing when treatment focuses on metastatic sites rather than primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L31)
key_concepts: Treatment directed toward metastatic sites only (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L30)
Metastatic site as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 37, L30)
Primary malignancy as additional code (Evidence: pg no: 37, L31)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The metastatic site(s) is designated as the principal/first-listed diagnosis when treatment is directed toward metastatic sites only (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L30)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the focus of treatment is specifically on the metastatic disease rather than the primary tumor, the metastatic site takes precedence in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L30)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The primary malignancy is coded as an additional code (Evidence: pg no: 37, L31)
detailed_rules.explanation: Even when treatment focuses on metastases, the primary malignancy must still be coded but as a secondary diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 37, L31)
common_applications: Primary breast cancer with treatment of bone metastases
Primary lung cancer with treatment of brain metastases

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify that treatment is directed toward metastatic sites only
Step 2: Assign metastatic site as principal/first-listed diagnosis
Step 3: Code primary malignancy as additional diagnosis

code_ranges.description: Secondary malignant neoplasms (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L31)
code_ranges.requirement: Used as principal diagnosis when treatment directed to metastatic sites
usage_rules: Metastatic site as principal when treatment directed there (Evidence: pg no: 37, L30)
Primary malignancy as additional code (Evidence: pg no: 37, L31)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with primary breast cancer admitted for surgical resection of liver metastases only
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Admission for hepatic resection of metastatic breast cancer to liver
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify that treatment is directed only toward liver metastases
Step 2: Assign liver metastases as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Add primary breast cancer as additional diagnosis

correct_coding.sequencing: Metastatic site first, then primary malignancy
correct_coding.rationale: Treatment is directed toward metastatic site only (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L31)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Primary breast cancer should not be principal when treating metastases only
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Sequencing primary malignancy first when treatment is for metastases only

warnings: Do not sequence primary malignancy first when treatment is directed only toward metastatic sites (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L31)
best_practices: Always identify the specific focus of treatment to determine correct sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L30)
common_mistakes: Sequencing primary malignancy first when treating metastases only (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L31)
tips: Treatment focus determines sequencing priority (Evidence: pg no: 37, L29-L30)
clinical_context: Applies to surgical resection of metastases, radiation to metastatic sites, targeted therapy for metastases
